comments.commentBody:
Earn a few dollars too much that year -- get a raise at work -- take a holiday job at the mall -- get some bonus overtime -- and the Feds will "clawback" that subsidy in a minute.

They tell you this upfront on the Health.gov website.
That is interesting since the rates for 2017 are not yet posted

Somehow, though, they manage in Great Britain, France, Australia, New Zealand.

Australia and New Zealand are #1 and #2 in top world obesity rates -- yes, higher than in the US (we are #4 worldwide).

Britain has awful nutrition, and in France, nearly everyone smokes, and it is the biggest market in the world for McDonald's outside of the USA.

The idea that WE are unhealthy and everyone else is slim, and eating vegan tofu and glowing with health....is totally incorrect and very prejudiced.

Universal health care will NEVER BE ACHIEVED when nags and nannies and shrews all insist on blaming certain people for their lifestyles, and hoping to exclude them from health care. That simply pushes such people into worse outcomes and eventually, into expensive ERs, hospitals or nursing homes. It has the OPPOSITE effect of what you hope to achieve.

Maybe I missed it, but I see no mention of what happened when G.W. Bush was president... Basically Bush told Putin that Russia was a threat to which Putin replied that he thought that America was the greatest threat to peace on the planet. Putin made some remarks along the lines of America, without restraint, meddling in world affairs and leaving disaster in it's wake. He also alluded to modernizing the Russian military to combat this potential threat (U.S.A.). As far as I can see, this is just what has happened. To that end, I'm not at all surprised at what Russia is doing today.

As an American, I have to agree with Putin. These actions taken by the U.S. government were beyond the needs of protecting the people of this nation. They were acts of pure aggression. It's time for America to rethink it's political aspirations and start working with the other nations instead of following it's present path. The reality is that the world is much worse off than it was before the middle east became embroiled in conflict.

I don't need to say it, but if Russia is pushed too far, the gloves come off. I think it would be safe to say that the U.S.A. would act the same way if attacked by Russia. I can't say that I know much about politics, but I do know when the situation is serious, and it's very serious. Not that my words matter, but just what issue is so important to these politicians that they would risk killing almost everyone on the planet?
See Fred Saberhagen's SF series on "The Berserkers." https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berserker_(Saberhagen)
Not all Americans.  A minority of paranoid loud ones.

Please stop with the familiar left wing phony argument about an "arms race." You could make the same argument about any weapon ever built, to include bows and arrows.

These weapons will be built, either by us or our enemies. If the last 400 years are any guide, those who fall behind in military technology have suffered some pretty dire consequences.

" When it comes to decisions over life and death, “there will always be a man in the loop,” he said. "

I feel safer already.

....And THAT worked out so well, in Ferguson and elsewhere.
If you don't pay your Amazon bill after the drone delivery, guess who's gonna come pay a little visit next?

@Gaaah

Nuclear-powered drones will effectively be powered forever.
I hope the primary mission the Pentagon envisions is the deployment of Gorts around the world - starting at the Pentagon and spreading to the rest of DC.

First of all, I'm not going to try to give advice to Nate, who seems perfectly capable of weighing his options and making sound decisions without the input of random strangers on the internet. I'm just here to share my personal experience:

I did college before and after the military. It was a lot easier post-military. I had the GI Bill, free health-care (this matters!) and, most importantly, I knew exactly what I wanted from my education. If I'd skipped my first 4 years of school and gone straight into the military, I'd have saved myself a lot of money and time. The networking I did in the military has also been useful in civilian life. For people who already want to serve their country, it's a great option. That said, some of the most miserable people I met were soldiers who were just in it for the benefits -- don't do that! As Nate said, it's a commitment and one you have to decide is right for you.

Self preparation and self reflection is crucial to getting the most out of everyone's encouragement and aid towards the journey that follows high school. Since you understand that you have distinct skill sets that you would love to develop, it would be best to find realistic ways for you to apply these skills in a career. A gap year is increasingly becoming an attractive choice these days since it offers the time window to look for opportunities to try out what you like.
In any case, you can always go back to school later. Well-prepared, goal oriented students are the ones that truly earn an education in college.

"It would be nice to see some top of the party democrats show outright opposition to Hillary much the same as the never trump republicans who ACTUALLY have shown some COURAGE which very sadly has been lacking from the sanctimonious holier than thou democrats..."....Here we go again with another false equivalency. Note that Obama, Biden, Warren, and Sanders have all gone out on the campaign trail for Hillary Clinton. Who has gone out on the campaign trail for Trump? McConnell, Ryan, who? At some point it should become obvious that no serious Republicans are out campaigning for Trump because they recognize him for what he is, whereas all the top Democrats are supporting Clinton. Is that because Democrats are lacking in character or because Trump is really really bad?

I'm sure your grandfather has the best intentions. But please do not join the military to wait out an economy or find yourself. Only join if yoy want to join.My husband is 35 and has been to more funerals than I can remember. A decade later and of the 20 or so soldiers he served with most closely, perhaps 3 have happy fulfilled lives and careers. The rest are drifting, suffering, getting over failed marriages. It's devastating to watch. Watching your friends bodies get ripped apart doesn't answer life's big questions.

You don't have to know what you want to do at 18 or 28 or 50. You can always reinvent yourself. It's just a lot easier to do it if you have a degree. If your ready for college, and it sounds like you are, then go! People are so caught up in having all the answers before you even start, it doesn't work that way. You'll figure it out. Grad school is for your passion. So many people wait for the right circumstances to start college and it never comes.

comments.parentUserDisplayName: S B Lewis, Lewis Family Farm
comments.commentBody: Farming is a dead end? Does this reader enjoy eating?

comments.userDisplayName: S B Lewis, Lewis Family Farm
comments.commentBody:
We have put many thought college. Our six and several others.

The liberal arts education from a really good college or university cannot be replaced. It teaches life and how to think. But there are many schools that talk the talk - and do not get there. So, care is needed.

We will help. We are easy to find. The reporter here is the best. She knows us.

If this or any student in Kansas has the needed record - or would like to have that record and for a good reason does not have it - we can help.

That said, a pause can help. But I am no fan of the military. J D Vance used the marines, went to OSU and then to Yale law. Did he get the liberal arts degree with meaning. His book suggests. Hillbilly Elegy.

No student should skip a good education if this is what he wants. Farming is a dead end. Learning to work with your hands is good. But a life of the mind cannot be replaced. Some farmers read. Most endure brain death.

The 18 year old should not borrow. There are other ways.

comments.userDisplayName: S B Lewis, Lewis Family Farm
comments.commentBody:
My advice to all students - and the young... get an education and do not borrow money.

Call us - and we can see what is possible.

comments.userDisplayName: S B Lewis, Lewis Family Farm
comments.commentBody:
My advice to all students - and the young... get an education and do not borrow money.

Call us - and we can see what is possible.
And you might have mentioned that illegal immigration into the U.S. is today at a 45 year low.

It's bad enough to contemplate Trump's reaction to a potentially huge election defeat.

Even worse, though, is to picture how a President Trump would deal with the frequent rebuffs that are part of every president's lot to suffer from even the most friendly Congress.
Good point - we must work on both fronts! Not judge other cultures but work to change.

Touching to see so many people condemning this (in a foreign country!) - but how many are taking action to fight ( in their own countries) the climate change that is fast bringing this majestic species to its end?  Melting ice = starving polar bears.  Is this well-fed trapped bear worse off than a free bear that dies of hunger because its environment is wrecked?

I am sorry to hear about the other animals as well as the sad polar bear. An elephant should not be incarcerated either.

It has been only recently (last year) that American circuses (Ringling Bros.) have bowed to pressure and announced they would not incarcerate elephants and use them for trained stunts. I think they are now in open spaces with other elephants. (Or is that wishful thinking?)

I once read about an elephant who used to be 'parked' facing a wall in a stall when it wasn't being used for something, I forget what. One day another elephant was brought in to the same barn. The first elephant looked at her and began trumpeting loudly. It turned out the second elephant had been a friend 30 years before, and they were now reunited!

Ringling's elephants have been taken to an elephant sanctuary that they have run for decades. They are Asian elephants (you can't train African elephants which is probably why they are going extinct).Asian elephants, like horses, oxen, camels, donkeys, all 'beasts of burden', have been bred & trained for certain activities. In the wild Asian elephants do activities very similar to what humans ask them to do. There are cruel humans who mistreat all animals & other humans. It doesn't mean that the animals should be sequestered.I knew a lady who was a good friend of themembers of Ringlings back in the 40's and 50's. She wrote a book about them. One of her friends was named Ruth. The girls who rode the elephants and did other sort of trained things in the circus were hired by the year. One year one of the girls and Ruth became good friends. When the music started for the opening parade (in which these 'show girls' rode in on the elephants) Ruth would leave her tent, go to 'her' girls and get her, at first it was only when the ground was muddy, then either muddy or it was wet, then every show. They did this all year, then the girl left, Ruth went to Sarasota for the winter. The next year everyone expected Ruth to go to that tent to get her friend, who had not rejoined the circus. She never did. Oh, Ruth was never led into the big top, she always took herself to the entrance, got in her place and waited for the announcement. Oh, Ruth was an elephant. When retired, she grieved.

This is exceedingly cruel.  Thank you for publicizing this.  These are rare, large intelligent mammals, and they need ample space and a place to swim.  These greedy, unethical business people must be stopped.

Yes, China has a very bad record of treatment of animals, but let's not put eating of animal meat into one big category. While eating dog meat is considered beyond the pale in  a lot of cultures, many countries have no problem eating horses. Japan, Korea and countries of the Steppes enjoy horse meat, and as do many Europeans countries. Horse meat eating is culturally taboo in most Latin American countries, but they have no problem slaughtering and exporting horse meat for consumtion to Europe. USA, Britain and Australia slaughter and export horse meat to other countries. Even though eating horse meat in these countries are not common, it's not illegal; our great neighbours- the Canadiens love horsemeat. Also, No, China hasn't single-handedly killed off the elephant population-  a lot of Africans, Europeans, and Americans play a big part in the elephant slaughter for ivory. All this is not to say, what is being done to that poor polar bear is atrocious. It is. I personally consider most zoos and "wildlife theme parks" as cruel and unnecessary places.

"No, China hasn't single-handedly killed off the elephant population- a lot of Africans, Europeans, and Americans play a big part in the elephant slaughter for ivory."

You are putting things way out of proportion. We and other civilized countries effect a ban on ivory trade whereas the Chinese economic delegations to Africa return gleefully with their suitcases stuffed with ivory. If there's room left they add rhino horns in their insane belief in its aphrodisiac properties.

The other civilized countries may have banned  ivory, but that does not mean their countrymen do not play a big part in the trade. The Chinese openly and gleefully stuff their suitcases, but plenty of people with money, from civilized countries covertly buy ivory and encourage elephant slaughter in many ways. So, how you buy ivory is not the problem, the fact that you do, is. As for rhino horns, lets not forget the French and their obsession with the ortolans. What I am saying is nefarious behavior towards animals is not the sole domain of the Chinese, almost everyone has their dirty little secrets somewhere. Theirs just happen to make good copy.

China has a horrible record of humane treatment of animals. Think of the ivory trade, rhino horns, eating dogs and horses to name just a few. China has almost single handily has killed off the elephant population on earth forever.

Again thank you NYT for bringing this story to a wider audience.
It is impossible to deport 11 million illegal immigrants. Anyone who says they can is lying to you.
you have a point;  to be fair a lot of chinese refer to white and blacks as white devils and black devils in Chinese and usually mean no malice.
